thread.title: Grammys 2017: Adele Offers Beyonce Her ‘Album of the Year’ Award (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: Grammys 2017: Adele Offers Beyonce Her ‘Album of the Year’ Award (VIDEO)

author: Jessica Bennett
title: Grammys 2017: Adele Offers Beyonce Her ‘Album of the Year’ Award (VIDEO)
text:
February 13, 2017 by Jessica Bennett 0 Shares Advertisement 
Adele has always been a fan favorite, and the British songstress proved that she’ll keep it real no matter what, even if it means giving up the most prestigious award in all of music. 
Tonight, Adele did the unthinkable, offering up her Grammy for Album of the Year to Queen Bey herself, Beyonce. 

The end of the night brought on stiff competition in the Record and Album of the Year categories, with both Beyonce and Adele considered the top contenders. 
First up was Record of the Year, with Tim McGraw and Faith Hill awarding the Grammy to Adele for her smash, “Hello.” 

During her speech, she shouted out Beyonce, saying she “adores” the singer. 
“You move my soul every single day.” 

Next up was Album of the Year, which Adele also won for her album, 25. 
After thanking her producers, engineers, writers and fans, the 28-year-old singer turned her attention back to Bey, saying she “couldn’t possibly accept this award” and that the Lemonade album “was so monumental.” 

Beyonce mouthed “I love you” through tears to the singer, creating what may become the most memorable moment of a very eventful night. 
— Hollywood Reporter (@THR) February 13, 2017 
Do you think Beyonce deserved to win Album of the Year? Sound off below.
